thread.title: HALLOWEEN 2015: Local casinos celebrate with parties, costumes and bingo
thread.title_full: HALLOWEEN 2015: Local casinos celebrate with parties, costumes and bingo - Press Enterprise

author: TIMOTHY GUY
title: HALLOWEEN 2015: Local casinos celebrate with parties, costumes and bingo
text:
By TIMOTHY GUY / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 14, 2015 6:06 p.m. HALLOWEEN 2015: Local casinos celebrate with parties, costumes and bingo Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Everyone 21 and older can get in the Cosmik Halloween Costume Party, which includes bingo, dancing, full bar and more. , COURTESY OF PECHANGA RESORT AND CASINO Related article » This year, the spookiest day of all falls on a Saturday. That means you can stay out longer and have as much fun as you can handle, and a number of Inland area casinos are going all out to make it the best possible Halloween. Just remember to have fun in moderation.
HARRAH’S
The loud noises coming out of Harrah’s Resort Southern California on Halloween are not of the zombie and monster kind. These noises are all about the bass. Haunted Harrah’s returns with multiple stages housing more than 25 DJs spinning hits all night long. Some of the DJs performing include Ashley Wallbridge, EDX and Bassjackers.
The night’s headliner is bound to get the party going strong. R&B artist Nelly will perform his hits including “Ride Wit Me,” “Hot in Herre,” “Shake Ya Tailfeather” and “Where the Party At.” The party kicks off at 8 p.m. and runs through 3 a.m. Tickets are $45-$60.
Harrah’s Resort Southern California, 777 Harrah’s Resort Southern California Way, Valley Center. Information: 760-751-3100, harrahssocal.com
MORONGO
If you happen to win big at Morongo’s bingo event, make sure to yell it in the creepiest voice possible. The casino’s Halloween bingo will feature 30 games paying $1,000. In addition, there will be costume contests for best witch, scariest and best bingo costume with $500 prizes. Buy-ins for the event are $99.
If you’re looking for a bit more activity, Vibe Nightclub will be spooky-ville with its Halloween Mansion party. Dance the night away with music from DJ Hektik.
Morongo Casino, Resort & Spa, 49500 Seminole Drive, Cabazon. Information: 951-849-3080, morongocasinoresort.com
PECHANGA
Dress up in your Halloween best and you could be a winner at Pechanga Resort & Casino. Everyone 21 and older can get into the Cosmik Halloween Costume Party, which includes bingo, dancing, full bar and more.
Prizes will be awarded for the best costumes. Paper bingo entries are $15, with electronic prices ranging from $25-$45.
The Eagle’s Nest club will having dancing all night long and anyone wearing a costume can get in without paying the cover charge. Up to $1,500 in prizes will be awarded throughout the night. There is a $10 cover charge for those not in costume.
Pechanga Resort & Casino, 45000 Pechanga Parkway, Temecula. Information: 951-693-1819, pechanga.com
SAN MANUEL
